jurisdiction.title: K20 Center - The University of Oklahoma

449CB21ADF3A4FA599E6C84A6D18AAA9.description: Students will evaluate how their self-awareness and engagement with diverse communities over high school have influenced their academic choices and college and career aspirations, setting at least one specific, identity-informed goal for transitioning to college, the workforce, or other college and career pursuits.

1B9B503892E04A658CFDC56B788C9A31.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic, personal, and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

98953756838D401CADB6559F4242B3E3.description: As part of college and career readiness activities, students will create a personal statement or capstone project linking their developing identity to college and career goals (e.g., essays for college applications, portfolios for technical programs). They will articulate how their unique background, values, and strengths position them for success in future academic or career pathways.

5CA67B93BCB34CAAAEE45C70D261A37E.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic, personal, and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

2C1A29C5532B4B3A9C71F5D7A6DD8224.description: Building on prior involvement, students will take on a leadership or advocacy role (e.g., planning events, mentoring younger peers, leading campaigns) in a school or community group that reflects their identity, explaining how this leadership experience contributes to personal growth and broader social impact.

CF60E3F18BF746738D479A0C62141E0B.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic, personal, and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

7966468AB22B41D7BCE3BAE58ED92124.description: Students will join or initiate at least one school- or community-based organization aligned with their personal or social identities (e.g., cultural clubs, service groups), documenting how participation strengthens their sense of self and fosters connections with mentors and like-minded peers.

4F1D0D50DA3B4781B4FC778E152569F4.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic, personal, and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

AD493F099F34469F96B04B19A065045F.description: Students will participate in group projects or discussions, clearly articulating ideas and providing constructive feedback, thereby improving their communication abilities and teamwork proficiency.

5040AB7DF8524CEFA51D26A2619B4545.description: Students will reflect upon how their sense of identity�now more fully developed�can support their future academic, personal, and social goals. Students will outline at least one way they can continue to nurture their positive self-identity in high school and beyond (e.g., joining cultural clubs, seeking mentorship, celebrating heritage).

4301B0C813664F9C9F4D0CE15EA41B28.description: Drawing on prior reflection and research, students will articulate a personal statement of identity (written or presented), emphasizing pride in their background and any other prominent social identities.

DC312D572D3D40E8B1F8E6F9D6BA0AE9.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

6D92E575B74749769F8273CD0F4F718D.description: Students will build and maintain positive connections with peers and educators by offering help, seeking assistance, and showing respect for diverse perspectives in classroom activities.

35AA3120FD144A9398FCB22F4415C075.description: Students will identify at least two individuals (historical or contemporary) who share one or more of their social or cultural identities and have achieved success, explaining how these role models inspire them academically or personally.

249561CC56C041CBA80762199F8547C7.description: Students will investigate the meaning of their heritage�interviewing family members, reading about cultural traditions, or exploring historical figures�and discuss how this knowledge enhances their self-understanding.

272E3DE474E6476BB12C6E523E6E0B37.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

65AF759847CF47B1B35DD095CF6757A8.description: Students will demonstrate active listening, empathy, and respectful interaction in both one-on-one and group settings, thereby strengthening their interpersonal and social skills.

A78A4EDBB16B492B92F743D8601A0186.description: Students will complete a simple reflection or class activity (e.g., a "Who Am I?"� collage) that explores their emerging racial/ethnic identity or other prominent social identities, recognizing how these aspects contribute to their uniqueness.

EDD8D4BDA99D4AA0AC742A061A808ABF.description: Students will identify personal traits (e.g., interests, talents) and describe at least one social group they belong to (e.g., family, cultural community, school club), examining how group membership begins to shape their sense of self.

3A5376B3E84148A6A7D02D3DC8DF315E.description: Students will recognize and explore their developing academic and social identities by reflecting on personal experiences, finding role models from similar backgrounds, and fostering a positive sense of self within a broader social context.

2A7126AF0C144EB184C2310C5835F634.description: Students will practice clear communication strategies (e.g., email etiquette, scheduled appointments, concise questions) for seeking assistance.

CE8E55BD24C74F508705D5FD211BDBBF.description: Students will recognize how to advocate for student disability services and accommodations in postsecondary education options.

F3D9BB20E28A4E1680C9FDC45915BB3B.description: Students will develop a plan to expand their network�attending school or community events, joining clubs, or connecting on professional platforms�and document their progress in creating new relationships that further their academic and career goals.

75B007CF10044326AC394AEC1486DC99.description: Students will recognize and seek support from trusted adults, utilize and expand their personal networks, and develop effective strategies for asking for help to enhance college and career readiness.

EABBEEE5700D45B3AB16B1E57AA08D2C.description: Students will identify and reflect on situations in which reaching out to an adult or peer is most beneficial.

75760C1A6CD74103875A839A2F7322FA.description: Students will map out their current network of support (e.g., family, friends, educators, community organizations), identifying how each connection can aid in college and career readiness.

547C422750A742FEA15000ABEB684BF9.description: Students will recognize and seek support from trusted adults, utilize and expand their personal networks, and develop effective strategies for asking for help to enhance college and career readiness.

8FDE22AD150E4164AF8ED97E161D8943.description: Students will practice clear communication strategies (e.g., email etiquette, scheduled appointments, concise questions) for seeking assistance.

6D8C3EC2829E441FA381122A9AEFFE7A.description: Students will identify at least three adults in their school or community (e.g., teachers, counselors, mentors) who can offer academic, personal, or career guidance, explaining the types of support each adult can provide.

FD68BCDD88854C6CAC08010F0CD9B2DD.description: Students will recognize and seek support from trusted adults, utilize and expand their personal networks, and develop effective strategies for asking for help to enhance college and career readiness.

03709F7515C04C60AC7CCB13BDE52C5D.description: Students will learn strategies (e.g., active listening, showing respect, maintaining confidentiality) to foster mutual trust with those offering help.

ED8E4745DD46470D9704AA958ACC86AA.description: Students will demonstrate a willingness to accept help by recognizing and trusting individuals and resources that can support their personal, academic, and social growth.

C39451CD2E4A4BA4ADBB5E915870591E.description: Students will practice asking for help in various situations�academic tasks, social or emotional challenges�demonstrating respectful communication.

4CA464C6DBA740E7A6750848C85BBF51.description: Students will demonstrate a willingness to accept help by recognizing and trusting individuals and resources that can support their personal, academic, and social growth.

3F31E168028440878A5F0B4641FF0FD8.description: Students will recognize individuals (e.g., teachers, counselors, family members, peers) and community resources (e.g., tutoring programs, online forums) that provide reliable assistance.

BC9B5AA31CB7412897577CA96327F648.description: Students will demonstrate a willingness to accept help by recognizing and trusting individuals and resources that can support their personal, academic, and social growth.

1312F77585ED4B9691FF75FBB5D4A1AE.description: Students will examine a recent conflict they experienced, analyze their response, and develop a plan to apply more effective conflict management techniques (e.g., using �I� statements, seeking mediation) in future situations.

BB539E0C821A4FC091EF00718820F259.description: Students will cultivate self-awareness by leveraging personal strengths, identifying areas for growth, engaging in ongoing self-evaluation, and fostering intrinsic motivation.

E8D69E4840154CED805D8CFD45414B3B.description: Students will articulate their belief in their own capabilities, sharing their successes and strategies used in overcoming external barriers with peers or teachers.

6A93E373ED294177BB4A9D45DE7EBE96.description: Students will practice consistent efforts to reach their goals despite setbacks, applying problem-solving strategies and learning from challenges.

353ED1C005B04DDBABCA1E7DF8A6731A.description: Students will demonstrate self-confidence by recognizing their ability to overcome external barriers and obstacles in order to achieve personal and academic goals.

DAF12035685240C58D9EB99AEFF84DF8.description: Students will show confidence in their ability to complete tasks, solve problems, and learn new skills independently or with appropriate resources.

8DD17AE678954EBC8C8FEEE441A911B0.description: Students will demonstrate belief in their own capacity for growth and learning by recognizing that intelligence and abilities can be developed through effort, effective strategies, and access to opportunities and resources.

6FA403082EED46A6975B872CD577437C.description: Students will identify common causes or triggers of conflict (e.g., miscommunication, differing values) and practice at least two strategies (e.g., active listening, compromise) to de-escalate and resolve disagreements.

60C9945745A1436A8319477BE2D2233C.description: Students will revisit previously identified external obstacles (e.g., lack of resources, time constraints, social pressures), reflect on the effectiveness of the strategies they used to address them, and adapt or add new strategies as needed to continue making progress toward their goals.

9BE8499B39794CE893A70E00883B0E90.description: Students will demonstrate self-confidence by recognizing their ability to overcome external barriers and obstacles in order to achieve personal and academic goals.

245A4B10F8D9479A9041032E83FBD5AB.description: Students will reflect on instances where effort and persistence led to improvement or success, reinforcing their belief in their ability to grow.

5952C51E0CB148739C80DFF29A2F1332.description: Students will demonstrate self-efficacy and belief in their own capacity for growth and learning by recognizing that intelligence and abilities can be developed through effort, effective strategies, and access to opportunities and resources.

6D8391BCAF794A3481DED9B48917CFBF.description: Students will brainstorm and select strategies (e.g., seeking support, adapting plans, using community resources) to address each identified obstacle.

65ED5169B6FD4A1F9B379DC0B1B609E6.description: Students will examine various external obstacles (e.g., lack of resources, time constraints, social pressures) that might hinder their progress toward goals.

49BA9D4C76B64099A5D1491EE0C254A0.description: Students will demonstrate self-confidence by recognizing their ability to overcome external barriers and obstacles in order to achieve personal and academic goals.

370E7F0FF46641FC9B3DCF6A334CF09E.description: Students will explain the concept of a growth mindset and identify how it differs from a fixed mindset.

BEA28729B2E34DBB869390FEA0E2B4CA.description: Students will demonstrate self-efficacy and belief in their own capacity for growth and learning by recognizing that intelligence and abilities can be developed through effort, effective strategies, and access to opportunities and resources.

E3A00029C53F42658D87D69963A8785E.description: Students will combine strategic reading, time management, and technology-based resources (e.g., online practice tests) to maximize their performance on standardized exams, while continuing to refine independent study routines to transition smoothly into postsecondary academics.

809A38CEC0E54E0DA6F0B08887D08694.description: Students will produce polished application essays by applying advanced editing techniques (e.g., careful proofreading, nuanced word choice) and incorporating feedback from peers, counselors, or mentors to achieve a high level of quality and precision.

44C46A43D4254E8AAE99247BB3D4DE2B.description: Students will strengthen bothcollaborative and independent study skills, refine academic writing, and develop strategic test-taking, reading,and interview techniques to excel academically and prepare for college and career success.

5A5A6687FD5443D1B318F155EB93D512.description: Students will compose clear and well-structured expository texts to explain, inform, or describe a topic, using evidence and logical organization to effectively convey their ideas. (Clarification Statement: To achieve this standard, students will engage in writing tasks aligned with grade-level state standards for English Language Arts, focusing on crafting explanatory texts with a clear purpose, coherent organization, and supporting details.)

B2FCE1E7451242608470287574194769.description: Students will foster curiosity, inquisitiveness, wonder, and imagination by applying scientific reasoning and engineering practices to investigate, analyze, and explain phenomena in the natural and designed worlds, demonstrating an understanding of scientific relationships and patterns. (Clarification Statement: To achieve this standard, instruction should align to grade-level state standards for science and engineering.)

138B7E2D39824EA4AAFC19ED2C625B66.description: Students will apply algebraic thinking to represent, analyze, and solve mathematical problems, demonstrating an understanding of mathematical relationships and patterns. (Clarification Statement: To achieve this standard, instruction should align to grade-level state standards for mathematics, focusing on concepts such as recognizing patterns, understanding variables, creating equations or expressions, and solving problems using algebraic reasoning.)

43FF6A8E0E1D464AA56D13311E5A0C39.description: Through simulated scholarship or college admissions interviews, students will practice articulating personal goals, academic achievements, and extracurricular experiences, focusing on confidence, professionalism, and active listening.

3E57BD7F04204895A1AF41EFC71DBF21.description: Students will draft preliminary college application essays, emphasizing personal voice, clarity of ideas, and alignment with application prompts, using peer and teacher feedback to refine content.

1F3F3D7420EC465E8117E7ED7054C5D2.description: Students will reflect on a difficult situation (e.g., a challenging project or personal setback), describe the steps they took to demonstrate resilience, overcome obstacles, and evaluate how self-management skills contributed to a successful outcome.

DC548CE80AF248B68614AD14F3D3F275.description: Students will develop and apply self-management strategies�such as effective time management, stress regulation, and a focus on optimism�to persevere toward their personal and academic aspirations.

F620EF96713A47A384C6EE8F69C709C5.description: Students will set at least one personal or academic goal and document the strategies they use to remain hopeful and motivated, noting how positive thinking and self-encouragement affect their progress.

AA63A36CE47B496798F7B08C13452067.description: Students will develop and apply self-management strategies�such as effective time management, stress regulation, and a focus on optimism�to persevere toward their personal and academic aspirations.

0222918F4F014C7198B538B9AC717FE2.description: Students will create and follow a weekly schedule that prioritizes assignments, extracurricular activities, and personal commitments, reflecting on any adjustments needed.

CF90C44D329D41AEBA592BFCFD266584.description: Students will develop and apply self-management strategies�such as effective time management, stress regulation, and a focus on optimism�to persevere toward their personal and academic aspirations.

034CEF7372D0445596F9186D8276F98A.description: Students will identify their emotions and practice strategies (e.g., mindfulness, self-reflection) to stay focused, calm, and motivated during challenges.

10491D9FF8F049D58E9DD2D90FFD7A1D.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to prioritize tasks, create schedules, and use tools (e.g., planners, digital apps) to manage their time effectively.

4EBF184FCB824F1EBBFE4AA9A0E8AE97.description: Students will demonstrate self-management skills by managing time effectively, regulating emotions, and developing strategies for overcoming challenges to achieve personal and academic success.

DB50FF14A6294FCFB5B2BEE50D98937E.description: Students will regularly document how their emotions impact their actions, decision-making, and progress toward set goals, making adjustments to their plans as needed.

73F1789AF9D34139B2FFE559E422CFD4.description: Students will recognize and label common emotions (e.g., anger, disappointment, enthusiasm) and describe how these emotions can either support or hinder their goal-setting and achievement.

D9C5612AF07D41568EE02570E81CB4A3.description: Students will practice prioritizing tasks, creating schedules, and using tools (e.g., planners, digital apps) to manage their time effectively.

AC49CB44B1074CFE8477DAC2C6A0328A.description: Students will practice strategies for managing time effectively and regulating emotions, enabling them to set and pursue personal and academic goals with greater focus, resilience, and confidence.

612A8354A18C4E64B1A72A8F09BB451F.description: Students will use identified motivators to create plans or strategies for achieving personal or academic goals.

86CE764519CC4474A95E93D26C5EF439.description: Students will identify factors that inspire or drive them, such as interests, values, rewards, recognition, or personal aspirations.

5EE281CF150246FEB07360A116EF4E03.description: Students will identify strategies for prioritizing tasks, creating schedules, and using tools (e.g., planners, digital apps) to manage their time effectively.

7A10F750E0784777A995B6F0A0157B1F.description: Students will identify effective time management skills and personal motivators, analyzing how these factors influence their behavior, decision-making, and goal achievement in personal and academic contexts.

1CB6F598450B4266B28D178D50DD68ED.description: Students will finalize and implement their action plans by completing key steps (e.g., submitting applications, applying for scholarships, meeting with advisors), evaluating how effectively each strategy supported their aspirations, and demonstrating a strong belief in their capability to transition to their chosen postsecondary paths.

E3F8F3A127E947888D5B48A8B850D95C.description: Students will articulate their college and career aspirations, identify potential obstacles, and outline strategies to overcome them, demonstrating a belief in their own capability to achieve these goals.

D8B12D9325AB4939BF96392E2EF8274A.description: Students will create a preliminary roadmap (e.g., scheduling standardized tests, drafting application essays, seeking financial aid advice) to overcome previously identified obstacles, sharing how each step enhances their readiness and reinforces their belief in their ability to achieve college and career goals.

74286D0F7C894B7B91AFEA79AB314F66.description: Students will articulate their college and career aspirations, identify potential obstacles, and outline strategies to overcome them, demonstrating a belief in their own capability to achieve these goals.

FEA20AED0B5741F284B2F75200E6041C.description: Building on their identified aspirations, students will research specific programs or institutions, detail at least two new potential obstacles (e.g., admission deadlines, standardized test requirements), and refine their strategies to address each, demonstrating increased confidence in their ability to succeed.

E478CF0CC69342C8A053E0C3F0A7AC89.description: Students will articulate their college and career aspirations, identify potential obstacles, and outline strategies to overcome them, demonstrating a belief in their own capability to achieve these goals.

50AE03E8EE8942DAADFA393D455458F3.description: Students will identify at least two college and career aspirations (e.g., attending a four-year college, earning a technical certification) and list initial obstacles (e.g., finances, academic requirements), proposing one basic strategy to address each.

B4FDEDCD49F345C0912BF52AA489CA0D.description: Students will articulate their college and career aspirations, identify potential obstacles, and outline strategies to overcome them, demonstrating a belief in their own capability to achieve these goals.

8FA9F5649F1A4F3794401BBEC9720BF9.description: Students will develop a career pathway plan that includes specific milestones, potential obstacles, and resources or supports.

2AA1461DBA99434DA3DA602D0D621CCB.description: Students will identify at least two individuals in their community who have pursued different postsecondary pathways, engage them in conversations about their educational and career experiences, and summarize the key insights gained in a short reflection or presentation.

D73674377FAE4A1F96C138553EC60D10.description: Students will review and assess their previous goals, examining which strategies were most effective and why. They will then connect these insights to potential postsecondary pathways, explaining how past successes and challenges can inform future educational and career planning.

AA993FD2677040D1AD51938AD1A9F5E1.description: Students will engage in goal setting by identifying, planning, and monitoring personal and academic goals.

CD1F06EF9A0E4B34A9E82C1373346F52.description: Students will build on their previous goals-setting experiences, and establish two new goals�one short-term and one longer-term�along with at least one accountability strategy (e.g., partnering with a peer, regular teacher check-ins) to help maintain motivation and track progress.

411F6EE63B564D118707F84DE4005AB2.description: Students will revisit their goals from the previous academic year and reflect on their progress and, if necessary, adjust their goals or strategies to address challenges and stay on track.

D3D946C7165F46BFB552549CBC123E0B.description: Students will engage in goal-setting by identifying, planning, and monitoring personal and academic goals.

EB6B5B3356A949A9AE05D68187114D0F.description: Students will track and document their progress toward achieving their goals over the school year, using tools such as journals, charts, or digital apps.

C3692D66F8DF481FBF55E176294F03B3.description: Students will brainstorm at least two short-term goals�one personal and one academic�and develop a simple action plan, including steps, resources, and a tentative timeline for achieving each goal.

AFD4BF97495E4E8DBFAB8AE31C0C96E1.description: Students will engage in goal-setting by identifying, planning, and monitoring personal and academic goals.

71AF7EA530AF4E4EAF2ECE57643DC29B.description: Students will discuss the support available through postsecondary campuses with their family.

6CD47B1B705040C997DC61A6399EB20A.description: Students will researchand present at least three on-campus or virtual resources (e.g., tutoring centers, counseling services, academic advising) that are typically offered by postsecondary institutions, explaining how each resource can support student success.

84249B38713F4AE680C6810B0614EFB7.description: Students will develop familiarity with postsecondary support available (e.g., tutoring centers, counseling services, academic advising) and identify available campus resources that support student success once admitted or enrolled.

01D9D6833AA54D8BBA66ED8C8E5F0348.description: Students will discuss steps required to prepare forpostsecondary pathways with their families.

1FAFABF45E3F49938555D85D8D3F40F8.description: Students will identify scholarships to support access to postsecondary pathways and apply for scholarships.

2896238069934E87B33A9EFEFBB45B16.description: Students outline the steps, necessary documentation, and deadlines to apply for match and fit schools and career technical assistance centers.

40ECFC735C4740C6BCCDBA0E80EEFD04.description: Students will outline the steps and deadlines for completing the FAFSA and other financial aid applications (including required documentation andannual renewal), demonstrating they can effectively plan and secure funding for postsecondary education.

35284894FDD24E3EB64DC0297AEA92D5.description: Students will demonstrate a clear understanding of essential processes for accessing postsecondary education, including financial aid (FAFSA), scholarships, and applications for colleges, universities, and career technical programs, by recognizing key deadlines and required documentation.

6AB9AEF4755C43398A980C782C6BD0D5.description: Students will identify at least two potential advantages (e.g., cost savings, accelerated degree completion) and two possible drawbacks (e.g., time constraints, transferability issues, GPA) of dual enrollment, evaluating how these factors influence their educational plans.

7E3C794A298D4C94956A39544053F25C.description: Students will evaluate dual enrollment opportunities, explore various college and career options, and connect advanced coursework (including math and electives) to college and career readiness.

5A2781E5BEC74F4992106E0E619BA86B.description: Students will discuss postsecondary pathway interests and plans with theirfamilies.

5F570B6949A14405996F19B4CC66D4D8.description: Students will meet with school counselors or other school staff about match and fit schools and other college and career options.

58AB614C087D4F6193E2DAC7659F3C04.description: Students will create a visual or written timeline showing the major milestones (e.g., admissions deadlines, financial aid applications, enrollment requirements) and time commitments for various postsecondary pathways (e.g., traditional four-year colleges, community colleges, career technical education programs, apprenticeships, military service).

CB2D40CA934A498483367B2FBCF2C37D.description: Students will examine and outline the key processes involved in multiple postsecondary pathways, including applications, financial aid, interviews, standardized testing, essay writing, performance requirements, and portfolio creation, summarizing the steps, deadlines, and resources needed for each.

E3F608CFCB6C4329B53458506DE11ABC.description: Students will investigate and plan for potential postsecondary pathways by identifying key milestones.

73ED4C70170043DF84B762A9543837D8.description: Students will select two elective subjects (e.g., art, technology, social sciences) and describe how the structure of knowledge and �ways of knowing� in these courses contribute to broader educational and career pathways.

1FA4A037DD964ABC9FF33BCF0042D789.description: Students will map out how advanced math courses such as Algebra II, Pre-Calculus, or Statistics align with college and career preparation standards, explaining how mastery of these subjects supports their future academic or career goals.

B556567E080F470CBA88C2A250AF466D.description: Students will evaluate dual enrollment opportunities, explore various college and career options, and connect advanced coursework (including math and electives) to college and career readiness.

2E115B64F6D74258B990E4B741589EC5.description: Students will discuss postsecondary pathway interests and plans with their families.

2C67113686F743C79CFE7B3F56435E9A.description: Students will research and compare the costs (e.g.,tuition, fees, living expenses) of these pathways and estimate theirpotential return on investment (ROI), taking into account projected career salaries or wages.

F34DECEC52634618B3E4519A50E720CE.description: Students will determine specific high school courses, standardized tests (e.g., ACT, SAT, ASVAB), application forms (e.g., FAFSA, college applications), and resources (e.g., scholarships, grants) needed for each pathway.

017ABD767C3844A586CEBEF915CD5393.description: Students will identify at least three possible postsecondary pathways (e.g., four-year college, community college, technical school, military service) and outline the typical duration and major requirements of each.

B60F48D5CA494D32B857E364B008A46B.description: Students will explore and evaluate the cost-benefit aspects of different postsecondary pathways.

27F7858DBACC46CF94F1D8A01AAF0A5C.description: Students will identify and showcase their individual academic strengths and interests, using tools such as self-assessment surveys or reflections on past successes.

DD8D52312C9E4823B19B39FA2F498C99.description: Students will explain how attendance, GPA, course choices, behavior, extracurricular activities, and community involvement can shape their academic profile and future opportunities.

A5C3919D25EC47CFABB218F9043CF326.description: Students will identify and describe the habits, skills, and resources that contribute to effective academic preparation (e.g., study routines, time management, seeking help).

364445C41BC04E21BBBDFFBB5C787961.description: Students will identify the components of academic preparation, recognize their personal academic strengths, and analyze how early academic and personal choices (e.g., attendance, GPA, course selection, behavior, extracurricular participation, community involvement, test scores) can influence future educational and career opportunities.

EA3B43F6FF704F548D6C5556AEA5EA89.description: Students will discover how their interests and skills can lead to fulfilling, income-generating career opportunities, recognizing that passion and proficiency can align with professional success.

8C687C4228964838B2A20CBEEBBC671A.description: Students will discuss at least two advantages and two potential challenges for each pathway, showing they understand various factors (e.g., earning potential, flexibility, skill development, job market demand).

969B5FFD72A642C28E29A1884F203061.description: Students will list and describe key characteristics of each pathway (e.g., program length, cost, admission requirements, types of credentials).

FA73FDC917D144BC9A05ABB63C38F236.description: Students will identify and compare different postsecondary education pathways, including traditional four-year colleges, community colleges, career technical education programs, apprenticeships, military service, and direct entry into the workforce.

4D2E895EB4DC4D1EA960CD53EA35D9A9.description: Students will explain how career and education plans can evolve over time, demonstrating an understanding that goals and interests may change.

9F785F8DA7F84DDC9A5E252AC15388B6.description: Students will articulate why planning for postsecondary education and a career at an early age is beneficial for their future opportunities and decision-making.

2FE6DAA170A54B8D98B51628419E3234.description: Students will explore the importance of early planning for college education and careers, recognizing the flexibility of changing goals and the existence of multiple pathways to success.
